name: Global Business Reports
description: Global Business Reports (GBR) provides in-depth analyses and up-to-date insights into all aspects of the mining, energy, chemicals, life sciences and aerospace industries in countries all around the world. Our research includes face-to-face meetings with the main protagonists in the field to form an accurate picture of the actual situation on the ground. We introduce our readers to Who’s Who of each sector, as well as explaining Who thinks What? Best decisions depend upon the best information - which GBRs reports are prepared to provide.

name: Chemicals Knowledge Hub
description:
Connecting industry across the globe

The Knowledge Hub was founded to provide a rapid-publication service to the speciality chemicals industry. Covering life sciences, pharmaceuticals and cosmetics to agrochemicals and polymers, contract manufacturing to chemical regulations, and always with an eye on sustainability and corporate responsibility, this fast-growing, ever-evolving industry needs a one-stop site that provides up-to-date news and reviews from key opinion leaders and captains of industry. If you develop, manufacture, distribute, use or regulate chemical products that provide qualities or effects on which other industry sectors rely, this site is relevant to you.

name: Chimica Oggi - Chemistry Today
description:
Chimica Oggi – Chemistry Today is a peer reviewed, bimonthly journal, of the TKS TeknoScienze Publisher. It deals with Fine Chemicals, Applied Chemistry and Biotechnology. Founded in 1983 Chimica Oggi – Chemistry Today soon became a leading journal in linking industry and academia and gained an immediate appreciation worldwide.
ISSN 0392-839X, EISSN 1973-8250
Yearly, this journal receives IMPACT FACTOR from Thomson Reuters and Scopus.

name: Echemi
description: The name is originated from the abbreviation of “E-commerce of chemical”. Echemi Group is a chemical supply chain service company headquartered in Hong Kong, providing chemical raw materials supply, research and analysis, digital solutions, marketing, distribution, logistics, e-commerce and after-sales services. Echemi Group Ranked 66 in ICIS Top 100 Chemical Distributors in 2020. At present, the product ranges mainly cover paint & coating, food & nutrition, fine chemical, pharmaceutical, and rubber & plastic. In the next decade, Echemi will focus on supply chain services, resources optimization and management efficiency, providing better products and services.

name: the Medicine Maker
description: The development and manufacture of small molecules, biologics, and advanced therapies draws on the talent, passion and experience of a wide range of professionals. At The Medicine Maker we bring those people into the limelight, showcasing the industry’s success stories and examining its biggest points of contention. Engaging content covers the entire spectrum of drug development, keeping all medicine makers up to date with the most pressing topics, trends and technologies driving the pharma industry forward.

members.biography: I've been working in the Pharma Industry for close to 30 years, mainly in the Business Development and Commercial Operation areas. I started with Procaps as the Export Manager, handling International Sales, then was promoted to General Manager of the Softigel Business Unit, and more recently to Vice President of Business for markets sucha as the USA, Canada, and Europe. I am based in Miami, Florida, and live there with my wife and three children.

members.jobTitle: Senior Commercial Director, New Business Development

members.biography: Carlos holds a Chemical Engineering Degree from Universidad Nacional in Colombia, a Production & Quality Specialist Degree from Universidad Tecnológica de Bolivar and a MBA from Universidad del Norte also in Colombia, with 14 years of experience in companies belonging to the chemical and food industry in different roles and leading positions from R&D and Quality to Technical Services and Commercial. Due to his deep knowledge in Omega-3 fish oil concentrates, Carlos is technically supporting and leading new nutritional product formulations based on Unigel technology.

Master in business administration with background in cars, port, ground transportation and Pharmaceutical industries. Leading strategic and cost-efficient process in operations and commercial departments, great leadership and team work capability. High performance athlete in Ironman races.     my role atm is to explore the South East Asia to bring our services as CDMO to this region.
I am a production engineer, specialist in international trade, I have been working in the pharmaceutical industry for 15 years and I have been linked to the Procaps Group for 9 years.

Creating value and exceptional experiences for companies in the pharmaceutical and nutraceutical industries

name: ICP
description:
ICP Rivista dell’Industria Chimica, founded in 1973, has reached the leading position in technical press; that’s why become the monthly reference point for the decision makers of the chemical and pharma industry and process engineering in Italy. It is also the first multimedia magazine with podcasts, interactive insights, video tutorial and much more.
ICP has also two “specials”:

  Italian Technology published in Italian/English version and distributed during Achema
  Powtech exhibitions and the December issue, entirely devoted to Buyers’Guide of Suppliers of Chemical and Pharmaceutical Industry, a complete review of the main suppliers of Process Industry, classified by sector

ICP Rivista dell’Industria Chimica, founded in 1973, has reached the leading position in technical press; that’s why become the monthly reference point for the decision makers of the chemical and pharma industry and process engineering in Italy. I work with clients on the east coast of the USA helping them move their assets from preclinical to commercialization.

If time is too tight to come to Basel, you can find me at CPhi 2021.

members.biography: Nanoform works to improve the lives of patients globally by overcoming drug development and delivery challenges through our game-changing technologies and novel formulation capabilities. We have a dedicated, multi-disciplinary team with a combined experience of launching 100+ medicines.

Christian is the Chief Commercial Officer for Nanoform and leads the business activities for the company. In his role he works with Pharma and Biotech partners to bring their drug molecules back to life by rapidly improving their solubility and bioavailability through the application of Nanoform's proprietary solution to nanoparticle technology.  He has a strong record commercially in Pharmaceutical Particle Engineering, Drug Substance (DS) and Drug Product (DP) Development and Manufacturing.

Dr. Christopher P Worrall joined Nanoform as the VP of US Business Development in May 2021.  He is an expert in the area of crystallization and physicochemical modification, having spent the last 16 years specializing in the pharmaceutical solid form, including 13 years with Pharmorphix.  Dr. Worrall has been involved in the development of 11 commercial pharmaceutical products and is an inventor on multiple patents, including the pharmaceutical solid form.

name: CPhI Discover
description:
Launching from 17-28 May 2021, CPhI Discover provides a place where pharmaceutical professionals can meet, discuss, partner, source and learn online. No need to travel.. We’ll bring the international pharma industry to you, on your laptop, or mobile, in your living room or home office – your event, your rules.



Join us for 3 days of industry-leading content including 45+ insightful, inspirational and educational content sessions delivered by industry experts PLUS 5 days of virtual meetings including opportunities to connect with over 570 exhibiting companies and 13,700 attendees. 

CPhI 365 Digital Solutions
Position your company at the heart of the pharmaceutical industry with targeted brand awareness activities, lead generation and thought leadership campaigns.
Learn More


CPhI North America:
CPhI North America is your platform to pharma innovation and the latest advancements within drug manufacturing and development. From ingredients and outsourcing to manufacturing and finished products, the event offers pharmaceutical buyers and suppliers across the full supply chain the opportunity to cultivate meaningful connections and relationships within the Americas region. Timing: July 19 – August 13. Location: Online and in Philadelphia, US.
Learn more 


CPhI Worldwide:
CPhI Worldwide: Connecting made simple - the pharma industry’s preferred event goes fully hybrid! Drive new connections and meet the pharma professionals you need to get business done in a safe, simple, smart, and more effective way – wherever you are in the world. Timing: October 18 - November 19. Location: Online and in Milan, Italy.
Learn more

name: EXCiPACT
description:
WHAT IS EXCiPACT?
Regulators require excipient users to qualify their suppliers based on GMP/GDP audits and they have indicated that third party auditing of suppliers is acceptable if a creditable certification body issues certificates and audit reports by employing qualified auditors who are demonstrably credible in suitable GMP/GDP standards and in the needs of the pharmaceutical industry. EXCiPACT asbl is a non-profit organisation that owns and manages oversight of such an independent, high quality, third party Certification Scheme available to pharmaceutical excipient manufacturers and distributors worldwide.
htmlDescription:
WHAT IS EXCiPACT?

Regulators require excipient users to qualify their suppliers based on GMP/GDP audits and they have indicated that third party auditing of suppliers is acceptable if a creditable certification body issues certificates and audit reports by employing qualified auditors who are demonstrably credible in suitable GMP/GDP standards and in the needs of the pharmaceutical industry. EXCiPACT asbl is a non-profit organisation that owns and manages oversight of such an independent, high quality, third party Certification Scheme available to pharmaceutical excipient manufacturers and distributors worldwide.

name: Pharmapack
description:
13-14 October 2021
Ever since its launch in 1997, Pharmapack has been one of the key meeting places for the pharma packaging & drug delivery industry. Growing year on year, its unique concept has attracted key industry players from all over the world.
The 2021 edition will gather more than 410 exhibiting companies and attendees from 75 different countries. The unique combination of exhibition floor, semi-scientific conferences and a dedicated spotlight for innovations, allows you to focus on networking and information gathering to help move your business forward.
Learn More

name: CPhI India
description:
24-26 November 2021
The Indian pharmaceutical market is growing at 15% annually, twice the world market growth rate. While its generics market is growing strong, it is also evolving into a cradle for new drugs. Simply put: as one of the strongest emerging markets in the global pharma industry, India presents great opportunities for all international pharmaceutical companies to explore and benefit from.
CPhI & P-MEC India represents the platform where international and domestic pharma experts meet to do business, network and shape the future of the Indian and South East Asian pharmaceutical industry.
Learn More

name: CPhI Korea
description:
11-13 October 2021
CPhI Korea is a dynamic meeting place where pharmaceutical suppliers, purchasers and decision-makers get together for three days of uninterrupted business. 
Exhibiting companies showcase products from across the entire pharma supply chain: from ingredients and contract services, through to machinery and biopharmaceuticals.
The event’s high-level conference, which runs throughout the three days, aims to give you in-depth insights into Korea’s pharma market and covers its latest trends, challenges and opportunities.

members.biography: Kieran has over 15 years’ experience leading Pre-formulation and Formulation Development teams in both innovator and contract manufacturing organisations. His expertise is in selecting and optimising drug delivery systems based on the physicochemical and biopharmaceutics properties of the active ingredient. Oral delivery of poorly soluble compounds is a particular field of experience and interest, in which he has successfully advanced products using hot melt extrusion, nanomilling and lyophilisation. Kieran’s responsibilities at Quotient Sciences include the design and implementation of integrated pharmaceutical and clinical development programs, utilizing Quotient’s ability to manufacture drug products in real-time in response to arising human data.

Quotient Sciences is a global pharmaceutical development, clinical pharmacology, and manufacturing organization, delivering innovative, customized solutions for pharmaceutical and biotech customers worldwide. We’re streamlining the drug development process by providing pre-formulation screening, formulation development, first-in-human trials, and clinical and commercial manufacturing services all at one CDMO, allowing us to support drug programs from concept through commercial supply.

We offer the full range of solubilization technologies including spray drying and hot melt extrusion and are capable of handling highly potent compounds at our development facilities in the US and UK. Our unique Translational Pharmaceutics® platform integrates formulation development, real-time adaptive GMP manufacturing and clinical pharmacology to significantly reduces costs and shortens timelines.

Our core expertise is in:
• Accelerating molecules from first-in-human to proof-of-concept
• Creating successful formulation & manufacturing strategies for poorly soluble compounds
• Developing optimized and scalable drug products
• Supporting pediatric, oncology & orphan drug development programs
• GMP Manufacturing and clinical supplies for Phase 1, Phase 2, and Phase 3 trials and Commercial Manufacturing.

For more information visit: www.QuotientSciences.com.

Over 20 years expert in Biotechnology & Pharma, Start-up and CDMO industries, business development and technical/R&D with the in-depth knowledge of drug product development and pharmaceutical manufacturing. Customer focused account manager and team player with expertise in establishing cross functional relationships & directing team activities.

Prasad has over 25 years’ professional experience, with 15 years’ in the CMO industry. Prasad develops and implements suitable workflows to achieve operational excellence in the manufacture of products, and mentors and manages formulation scientists and manufacturing teams. Prior to his current role at Quotient Sciences, Prasad worked at QS Pharma as Director of Formulation Development, and at Patheon, as Manager of Business Development Services and Senior Scientific Leader in the Formulation Process Development Group.

members.jobTitle: Vice President of Drug Development Sciences
members.biography:
Sarah Stevens, Ph.D. is the Vice President, Drug Development Sciences at Quotient Sciences. Sarah is responsible for global leadership of the Drug Development Consulting team, and the design of differentiated, integrated programs of work for pharma and biotech clients.

Sarah qualified as a PhD Pharmacist and then completed post-doctoral research at the University of Strathclyde in Glasgow prior to starting her career in industry. Over the last 15 years, Sarah has held a range of scientific and leadership roles within CDMO organizations, most recently at AMRI where Sarah led development and commercial sites both in the UK and US and was responsible for Drug Product Development.
